summary: This is a July 2, 2020, press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with conspiracy with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury related to 2016 depositions. The document details the alleged grooming and abuse scheme spanning from 1994 to 1997.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Arrested and charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors, including enticing and transporting minors, and with perjury. Alleged to have played a critical role in grooming and abusing victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier with whom Maxwell allegedly conspired to sexually abuse minor girls. Described as having a preference for young girls.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release and made a statement detailing Maxwell's alleged role in facilitating and participating in the sexual abuse of minors.

persons.name: William F. Sweeney Jr.
persons.role: Assistant Director-in-Charge of the FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Made a statement commending the victims for their bravery and condemning Maxwell and Epstein's actions.

persons.name: Dermot Shea
persons.role: Commissioner of the New York City Police Department (NYPD)
persons.context: Made a statement condemning the alleged crimes and commending investigators.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom Maxwell's case is assigned.

connections.description: Alleged to have conspired together to sexually abuse minor girls, with Maxwell facilitating, grooming, and participating in the abuse of Epstein's victims.
Alleged to have befriended, groomed, and delivered minor girls to be sexually abused by Epstein and, in some cases, by Maxwell herself.
Alleged to have sexually abused minor girls, with the abuse facilitated by Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested and charged in a Manhattan federal court indictment with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually abuse minors and with perjury.

events.title: Period of Alleged Abuse Conspiracy
events.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired to sexually abuse minor girls, with victims as young as 14, during this period.

events.title: Maxwell's False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Maxwell is charged with perjury for allegedly making false statements under oath during depositions in a civil proceeding.

locations: New York (Epstein's residence and location of federal court)
New Hampshire (location where Maxwell was to be presented in federal court)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, and charged with conspiracy to sexually abuse minors with Jeffrey Epstein, along with perjury.
The alleged abuse scheme ran from at least 1994 to 1997, involving victims as young as 14 years old.
Maxwell's alleged role included recruiting, grooming, and befriending victims to deliver them to Epstein for sexual abuse, and she was sometimes present during the abuse.
Abuse and grooming occurred at multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, and New Mexico, as well as at Maxwell's London residence.
The indictment includes charges for enticing a minor to travel, transporting a minor, conspiracy for both, and two counts of perjury from 2016 depositions.
